regimen: Prime Time Foundation Primer: Apply one pump for an even layer of this lightweight primer all over your face. Once dry, follow with bareMinerals SPF 15 Foundation.
Original Foundation Broad Spectrum SPF 15: Swirl a small amount of bareMinerals Foundation in the lid until it all disappears into the brush. Tap away excess. Buff onto the skin in a circular motion.

Concealer: Apply before foundation to effortlessly conceal imperfections. For lighter coverage or smaller areas of the face, use Light Stroke Brush. For full, concentrated coverage of detailed areas, use Maximum Coverage Concealer Brush. If needed, apply after foundation for extra coverage.

Mineral Veil Finishing Powder: Swirl a small amount of Mineral Veil by angling the Flawless Application Face Brush and swirl into the lid until all the Mineral Veil has been tucked into the bristles. Tap away excess. There should be no visible Mineral Veil on the outside of the brush. Buff the Mineral Veil into the skin in a circular motion, starting on the outside of your face near your cheekbone, swirling as you go. Buff around your face and then approach your forehead, cheeks, and nose.
name: Up Close & Beautiful 30 Day Complexion Starter Kit
description: bareMinerals Up Close & Beautiful 30 Day Complexion Starter Kit is a 30-day complexion starter kit.
details: This introductory kit will get you on your way to radiant, healthy-looking skin, beginning with a 30-day supply of award-winning ORIGINAL Foundation Broad Spectrum SPF 15 and signature essentials. Experience the look of beautiful skin with the flawless coverage you desire and none of the harsh chemicals your skin doesn't need.
ingredient: Prime Time Foundation Primer: Cyclopentasiloxane, Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Dimethicone, Silica, Magnesium Silicate, Ascorbic Acid (Vitamin C), Tocopherol (Vitamin E), Calcium Pantothenate (Vitamin B5), Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract.
Original Foundation Broad Spectrum SPF 15: Active: Titanium Dioxide 12.6%, Zinc Oxide 21%. Inactive: Bismuth Oxychloride, Mica, Iron Oxides, Zinc Oxide, Titanium Dioxide.
Concealer: Active: Titanium Dioxide 24.4%. Inactive: Mica (CI 77019), Bismuth Oxychloride (CI 77163), Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77499, CI 77492, CI 77491), Ultramarines (CI 77007).
Mineral Veil Finishing Powder: Zea Mays (Corn Starch), Corn Starch Modified, Zinc Stearate, Magnesium Stearate. May Contain: Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499).

name: Wishing You Grace & Love Coffret
details: Wish her happy holidays with scents of grace & love. This coffret set includes 3 unique, easy-to-wear fragrances, each designed to uplift and inspire an array of different moods. Philosophy fragrances are designed to draw others in and never overwhelm. Coffret set includes: Amazing Grace Eau de Toilette, Pure Grace Eau de Toilette and Loveswept Eau de Toilette, 0.33 oz. each.
description: From Philosophy: Wishing You Grace & Love Coffret includes 3 unique scents designed to uplift and inspire: Amazing Grace, Pure Grace and Loveswept. A $54 Value!

details: Discover your most naturally pretty eyes with an essential eyeshadow palette that's perfectly sized to go wherever you do, plus a game-changing mascara that goes beyond the ordinary to transform your lashes! Ideal to gift or to get, Naturally Pretty Essentials features 6 full-size, anti-aging shadows that, with a tap of the bonus Transforming Hello Light shade, turn from matte to radiant satin for a total of 13 eye-opening colors. Formulated with collagen, real silk and proprietary No-Tug Technology, each talc-free shadow glides on smoothly and neutralizes discolorations for younger-looking lids.

To enhance your gorgeous eyes, this palette comes perfectly paired with a travel-size Superhero Elastic Stretch Volumizing Mascara to give your lashes super volume, super length and super elastic stretch with just one coat! The proprietary Elastic Stretch Technology stretches the look of your lashes wider and longer, and wraps each individual lash in a volume-boosting, lengthening, ultra-conditioning black cape of power and color for your strongest, thickest, most defined results.
description: Naturally Pretty Essentials Grab & Go is limited edition Naturally Pretty Essentials¿ Your Superhero¿ Eyes Must-Have Eye Set. A $40 value!

description: Don't let the size of this Shadow Box palette fool you. It's loaded with a DOZEN of Urban Decay's most amazing shades - from pale to deep, matte to sparkly (including nine bestsellers and three never-before-seen shades!).
reviews: {'review_recommend': [], 'review_pros': [], 'review_text': [u"Beautiful colors :) I was a bit disappointed that it has no applicator to use. Having to pack my shadow brushes to go takes up time& space to fit in my small Go-To makeup bag. Thankfully this palette is really compact! This shadow is perfect for proms or any type of recital. The color choices gives so many options and different looks to pull off! I've found these colors do fade quickly (even using a primer & setting spray) so I must reapply by midday. But they're absolutely beautiful and the silky-smooth feel of these shadows, Make you feel like a million bucks! They're all Shimmer, except for the black, it's the only matte finish. This palette is Super- blendable & works well with almost any other brand of shadow So the shimmer is not over done (which can be easy to do, if you have small set eyes). These colors are great for any season. It is a bit costly but I use atleast one or two of the colors every day. Overall it was a great buy for me. {'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Applies Smoothly', u'Great Color', u'Long Lasting', u'Silky Texture', u'Small, great for travel'], 'review_text': [u"This product was my first palette purchase. I should have thought about the colors a little more carefully. At first, I really loved a lot of the colors, but there only a few I actually wear. A lot of the colors I would not pair together, so you'll want a pretty developed makeup collection to use some of the bolder colors  (Moonshadow and Indo). The only way I've been able to successfully wear these is to use them as a bright pop of eyeliner.", u"My favorite combinations from this palette are Bor dello and Tornado, Baked Cowboy and Smog, and Freelove and Lost. Other than these pairings, I have a hard time using the colors in this palette. Sin is a great base color and I use it to tone down a lot of the darker colors. I'm really fair skinned with light features, so I don't feel like really dark/bold eyeshadows look great on me. For others, the bold colors may be more wearable.", u"With that being said, I feel like this palette is versatile if you already have some other shadows to help you with your look. It's a bit more affordable than some of the others. I was drawn to variety in colors, but in the end I should've picked something more cohesive for my first palette."], 'author_name': [u'Bri'], 'rating_score': [u'3.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Colors could be more cohesive...'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Everyday', u'Going Out', u'Smokey Effect'], 'review_cons': [u"Colors aren't very cohesive", u'Too Sparkly'], 'date': [u'4/24/2016'], 'author_location': [u'Alabama'], 'author_type': [u'Classic Style']}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Applies Smoothly', u'Blends Easily', u'Great Color', u'Silky Texture'], 'review_text': [u'This is my first Urban Decay product. I give this pallette a "3" only because the shadows are decent quality. I am huge fan of Lorac\'s Pro 1, Pro 2, Pro Matte, Unzipped, and Unzipped Gold  pallettes and, for me, these shadows are not on the same level. The shadows in this UD palette are very shimmery with one matte (blackout) and no transition colors. The colors are also not very cohesive to one another, more of a random grab bag of UD shadows (which I\'m fine with). This palette is not a stand alone for me. However, there are boat loads of lid shadows and fun pops of color. A couple of the shadows are great for ine shadow looks. Even with a primer, the color fades within a few hours, but the shadows touch up well. In my opinion, it is an overall decent product that I will get a lot of use out of as long as I have some mattes on hand.'], 'author_name': [u'KJK'], 'rating_score': [u'3.0'], 'rating_title': [u'First exposure'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Everyday'], 'review_cons': [u'Needs supplemental colors', u'Too Sparkly', u'Wears Off Easily'], 'date': [u'3/6/2016'], 'author_location': [u'Pennsylvania'], 'author_type': [u'Trendy Style']}

details: It's the ultimate beauty dilemma: You're going away for the weekend and you can only bring ONE palette with you. Quick, which one do you choose? No need to give yourself a makeup-induced panic attack; Urban Decay's Shadow Box has you covered.

Don't let the size of this palette fool you. It's loaded with a DOZEN of Urban Decay's most amazing shades - from pale to deep, matte to sparkly. The lineup? Nine bestsellers and three never-before-seen shades you'll reach for again and again. Experiment with a diverse range of looks. Whether you want to do a purple eye, a green eye, a smoky eye or a shimmery eye, it's all here!

Inspired by Urban Decay's long-running Ammo Palette, with a completely updated (and even bigger) shade range, Shadow Box is the perfect all-in-one palette. Whether you're new to Urban Decay or you've got a whole stash of UD products on your vanity, the Shadow Box is one palette you need in your arsenal.

From new shades like Baked Cowboy (an amazing golden bronze) and Moonshadow (a stunning bright navy blue) to cult classics like Sin, Mushroom and Blackout, Shadow Box has something for everyone. Every shade features Urban Decay's Pigment Infusion System, the proprietary blend of ingredients that gives each shade its velvety texture, rich color, serious staying power and blendability.

The Shadow Box palette features dark, gorgeous orchids in rich purple hues. Inside, the same orchid artwork repeats in black and white (to contrast all of those amazing shadows!). The finishing touch: a cool magnetic closure in the shape of the UD icon.
ingredient: Indo/Bordello/Tornado/Smog/Freelove/Baked Cowboy: Mica, Talc, Diisostearyl Malate, Dimethicone, Zinc Stearate, Caprylyl Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Hexylene Glycol, Tin Oxide, Tetrasodium EDTA, Silica, Caprylic/Capric Triglycerides, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Calcium Aluminum Borosilicate, Polyethylene Terephthalate, Acrylates Copolymer.

Moonshadow/Lost: Talc, Mica,Diisostearyl Malate, Dimethicone, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Zinc Stearate, Caprylyl Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Hexylene Glycol, Tetrasodium EDTA, Tin Oxide, Silica, Caprylic/Capric Triglycerides, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Calcium Aluminum Borosilicate, Polyethylene Terephthalate, Acrylates Copolymer.

regimen: With fingertip, dab Boi-ing on the darkest areas you want to target...underneath each eye, at the inner corners by the bridge of your nose, or over any other flaws. Pat gently outward to blend.
Beauty tip: Pat concealer between your thumb and fingertip to warm it up...it will glide on more seamlessly.

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Blends Well', u'Easy To Apply', u'Easy To Take-off', u'Good Pigmentation', u'Lightweight', u'Natural Looking', u'Smooth'], 'review_text': [u"I have dark circles under my eyes that are exceptionally difficult to conceal. It's a genetic thing and they drive me crazy. ", u'In other words I look like a racoon. Lol ', u"Seriously, this doesn't cover them completely,  but I have used I don't know how many different products over the years and this is the best I've found. It lightens them by at least half to two thirds depending how dark they are on any given day. . I often have to reapply in the afternoon but it's super easy to put on .I use a brush to apply , (it's very creamy , so I have a specific brush I use to only apply this as its dan near impossible to get out of your brush once you use it to apply this. ) then I find that using my fingers to blend it in works well. It is semi waterproof , but if you get your face really wet you'll have to reapply. ", u'Comes off with soap and water. ', u'I apply every day , sometimes twice and a pot of this lasts about two months which is not bad as it really does help , so that works out to about 11 dollars a month so the price is worth it. I am a brunette with dark eyes and hair and medium fair skin so I use number 2.  I guess a blonde or red head would use a 1 and deeper skin tones can use the 3 or 4. I tried the 3 once and it was way too dark for me. ', u'I really like Bo-ing and will continue to use it as I have tried more expensive powders and concealers that were more difficult to apply and did not cover as well. ', u"Again , it doesn't cover my circles completely but it covers them better then anything else I've tried.  I do not leave the house without it on even if I'm wearing no other makeup at all."], 'author_name': [u'Lauren P.'], 'rating_score': [u'4.0'], 'rating_title': [u'I have serious dark circles and this is my go to product.'], 'review_bestuses': [u'All Skin Types', u'Everyday', u'Going Out', u'Sensitive Skin', u'Travel'], 'review_cons': [u"Doesn't Stay On"], 'date': [u'6/28/2016'], 'author_location': [u'Springfield, MO'], 'author_type': [u'Classic Style']}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Blends Well', u'Covers Well', u'Easy To Apply', u'Multipurpose'], 'review_text': [u"I bought this product because I couldn't find a drugstore concealer [of this consistency] in my skintone -- I find that even if the shade name said 'beige,' it was still too light for me. I have yellow undertones, and 02 definitely has pink ... though on my skin, it blends in fine so that complaint is negated. ", u"I use this to cover up light acne scars in conjunction to color correcting [before concealer]. Occasionally, I have used it over foundation for touch up, and it still blends in fine. I compare this to the Maybelline Coverstick Concealers as they are: creamy; easy to apply, and easy to blend. Unlike those concealers, this can be worn under sheer coverage foundations/tinted moisturizers. The only con I can pick out is the packaging. The size of the container is fine; it's still small and easy to store and travel with. I just wish that the lid wasn't a screw on. Overall, I like this concealer but I'm not in love with the pink undertone or the price tag. {'review_recommend': [u' ', u'No, I would not recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [], 'review_text': [u'I bought this product because I was told it was THE concealer to have. {'review_recommend': [], 'review_pros': [u'Easy To Apply', u'Goes On Smoothly'], 'review_text': [u"I have this product in shade 01. My primary use of this product is for concealing my under eye circles. I apply my foundation, apply Boi-ing, then apply a setting powder. The application is pretty easy, and I can get the right amount I need without wasting product. However, it creases, even with setting powder.. So I could imagine it would crease even worse for those who do not use powder. It does make my under eye circles LESS noticeable, but it doesn't completely conceal them like I would hope. It doesn't really do much for blemishes, either. It isn't super long lasting, and I have read others say they have to re-apply it during the day. I haven't yet found a concealer I truly love yet, but this product is okay. Probably the best I've tried thus far, but it's pricey for what it is and I definitely wouldn't consider it to be full coverage."], 'author_name': [u'Chesley'], 'rating_score': [u'3.0'], 'rating_title': [u"It's okay, settles in creases.."], 'review_bestuses': [], 'review_cons': [u"Doesn't Cover Well", u"Doesn't last long", u'Pricey', u'Settles In Creases'], 'date': [u'10/2/2014'], 'author_location': [u'NC'], 'author_type': [u'Brand Buyer']}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'No, I would not recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Multipurpose'], 'review_text': [u"I've been on basically a life-long hunt for something to help with the dark circles under my eyes. For about a year I've been using a liquid concealer by Smashbox, and that was working pretty well for me, but was pricey. I recently switched my liquid foundation from Smashbox to Benefit, and decided to try to do the same with concealers. I read reviews of all of Benefit's concealers on multiple sites, and ultimately decided that Boi-ing sounded like the best product for dark circles. Sadly, I'm not impressed. It does help to correct color, yes, but it settled into the creases under my eyes with the first couple of blinks after (a very difficult) application, and gave my skin a really crinkled, papery texture. I'm in my mid-20's, and this stuff made me look at least 10 years older. It does help the texture and settling a little if you set it with a powder, but even the color correction still doesn't last through a standard 8-hour desk shift. I'm hanging onto this for any blemishes that might pop up elsewhere on my face, but I'm going back to Smashbox for under-eye concealer."], 'author_name': [u'Jingle Bells'], 'rating_score': [u'2.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Helps Correct Color, But Not Texture'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Blemishes', u'Discoloration'], 'review_cons': [u'Difficult To Apply', u"Doesn't Blend Well", u"Doesn't Cover Well", u'Settles In Creases'], 'date': [u'3/11/2014'], 'author_location': [u'Fort Worth, TX'], 'author_type': [u'Brand Buyer']}

That is the only area, however, where I have noticed it settles in creases.  Other than that, it covers well, lasts most of the day and blends nicely with other products I put on.'], 'author_name': [u'Rachel M'], 'rating_score': [u'3.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Like it'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Blemishes', u'Discoloration', u'Under Eyes'], 'review_cons': [u'Settles In Creases'], 'date': [u'3/10/2014'], 'author_location': [u'Wheaton, IL'], 'author_type': [u'Brand Buyer']}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'No, I would not recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Covers Well', u"Doesn't Wear Off", u'Goes On Smoothly'], 'review_text': [u"Bought this to cover up my dark circles - not a fan.  I did a lot of comparisons, almost bought Erase Paste, and settled on Boing instead for reasons I cannot remember.  It settles into under-eye creases, which is my biggest complaint.  Also, I wore it over my BB cream and the two don't blend as naturally as I would like.  Does anyone else find it difficult to keep the concealer itself clean and debris-free?  Since it disappointed me as a cover-up for my dark circles I have found other uses for it.  Namely as a blemish or dark spot concealer for which it is well-suited.  I am still looking for an under eye concealer, but am happy to have found this as it works well to cover up blemishes and other unwanted dark spots. Let me recommend using a small concealer brush to apply... one that you clean frequently!"], 'author_name': [u'itsmehac'], 'rating_score': [u'3.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Dark circles - no, Blemishes - yes'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Age Spots', u'Blemishes'], 'review_cons': [u'Difficult To Blend', u'Messy', u'Settles In Creases'], 'date': [u'3/3/2014'], 'author_location': [u'TN'], 'author_type': []}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Blends Well', u'Covers Well', u"Doesn't Wear Off", u'Easy To Apply', u'Goes On Smoothly', u'Good coverage', u'Lasting Coverage', u'Multipurpose'], 'review_text': [u"I love this concealer!! I have really intense under-eye discoloration and this helps immensely. I also use it to cover blemishes, which it does flawlessly. I carry it with me during the day, but i hardly ever have to reapply as it stays on so well!! I will say since it is quite emollient that if you have very oily t-zone blemishes, this may not be the blemish concealer for you. But for under-eye circles it's the bomb! I also like how much product you get for the price. Other reviewers have said it settles into creases, and I had this same problem until my friend who is an MUA told me to simply use less and not to try to rub it in, rather just to pat it on. Since using less and patting instead of wiping, the creasing has stopped, so don't let that scare you off! All in all, it's become my favorite concealer and I highly recommend it."], 'author_name': [u'Tarik'], 'rating_score': [u'5.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Love it!'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Blemishes', u'Discoloration', u'Under Eyes'], 'review_cons': [], 'date': [u'2/13/2014'], 'author_location': [u'Baltimore, MD'], 'author_type': [u'Brand Buyer']}

Shade 1 is great for me when I have no tan, but Shade 2 is too pink and Shade 3 is too dark even when I have a full-on summer tan, so a better range of shades would be great. {'review_recommend': [u' ', u'No, I would not recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Blends Well', u'Easy To Apply'], 'review_text': [u"I had heard great things about this concealer, so I was excited to try it.  Unfortunately, for me, it didn't live up to the hype.  I buy a mix of prestige and budget cosmetics, and I was hoping that by investing more in a concealer that I would eliminate some of the problems I'd had with lower end concealers.  However, I still ran into some of the same problems, specifically creasing under my eyes.  I tried setting it with powder, but that just made my under eye area look cakey and dry.  The concealer also seemed to wear off pretty quickly when applied to other areas of my face.  It did, however, have pretty great coverage when I first applied it, was a good match for my skin tone, and blended well.  For these reasons, I gave the product three stars because it may very well work for someone else.  For me, if I'm going to have to deal with creasing, I don't want to pay the price that's asked for it.  I'm still on the hunt for my perfect concealer."], 'author_name': [u'Jess'], 'rating_score': [u'3.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Not that great for me'], 'review_bestuses': [], 'review_cons': [u'Settles In Creases', u'Wears off Easily'], 'date': [u'8/21/2012'], 'author_location': [u'Texas'], 'author_type': []}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Blends Well', u'Covers Well', u"Doesn't Clump", u"Doesn't Wear Off", u'Easy To Apply', u'Goes On Smoothly', u'Multipurpose'], 'review_text': [u'This is truly the only concealer that I will use, as it\'s completely multipurpose. I\'m a bit of a minimalist when it comes to how much makeup I want to use daily (how much I buy is a different story). If I can find a product that stays consistent and has many uses than I will hold onto it for dear life. I tried Boi-ing about 2 years ago, and since then I\'ve stuck with it. I just recently bought my fourth one, as it lasts forever. Not only is it great for covering redness, but it is great for discoloration in general. I don\'t typically wear foundation, but I do use the concealer daily as I have a bit of micro pigmentation from my earlier teen years of breaking out. It covers up my very prominent undereye circles,and all of those areas where either a blemish has formed or where there is a light scar from a previous blemish. It\'s creamy, matches my skin tone perfectly, and NEVER looks cakey, no matter how much I apply to one area. My only "beef" is that is settles into the fine lines under my eyes, but I\'ve discovered that as long as I put powder on before and after the concealer, I won\'t have a problem. Some people may find that it does not blend smoothly when they first get it, but I promise that if you keep using it the product will warm up and become extremely creamy. I highly recommend this concealer, and would be like a little lost puppy if it was ever discontinued (hint hint, Benefit).'], 'author_name': [u'SadieL1995'], 'rating_score': [u'5.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Only concealer I will use'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Blemishes', u'Broken Capillaries', u'Discoloration', u'Primer', u'Under Eyes'], 'review_cons': [u'Settles In Creases'], 'date': [u'6/23/2012'], 'author_location': [u'New England'], 'author_type': [u'Budget Buyer']}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Blends Well', u'Covers Well', u"Doesn't Clump", u"Doesn't Wear Off", u'Easy To Apply', u'Goes On Smoothly', u'Multipurpose'], 'review_text': [u"I have been using this product for a week or so to cover my dark under-eye circles and acne spots/redness. So far, I find it to work exceptionally well! I barely have to try to blend, works very well over foundation or under, and a tiny dab diminishes redness and shadows.I'd been cycling through cheap covergirl/maybellene/essence multipurpose concealers, mary kay (which rivals boi-ing but requires salespeople or shipping cost plus it has different pros/cons) and even ~$22 clinique matte concealor, and boi-ing works FAR better for me. Inexpensive concealors have NEVER had enough coverage for my deep-set eyes, and most of the cheapies have poor pigmentation and do not blend as well as boi-ing. I use the fair boi-ing and it matches much better with my foundation (neutragena acne foundation) and natural tone, so I don't need to put a layer of foundation over the concealor, and it blends into skin so well with a simple patting motion. Makes for quick and effortless application.This concealor is pretty much amazing and is actually worth the [$], especially if you've also had poor luck with other products having unnatural color and not giving enough coverage and blendability.LAST thing: I have extremely dry skin because I use strong acne fighting products on a daily basis. Virtually all full coverage concealors get clumpy/dry in spots because of my skin, but there's no way I would go without a concealor. A few other reviews hated on boi-ing for its clumping/drying effect, but I've found that using an oil-free moisturizer to soften the skin will help smooth concealor out and prevent flaky patches."], 'author_name': [u'Aimee'], 'rating_score': [u'5.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Worth it!'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Age Spots', u'Blemishes', u'Broken Capillaries', u'Discoloration', u'Under Eyes'], 'review_cons': [u'Settles In Creases'], 'date': [u'5/19/2011'], 'author_location': [u'MN'], 'author_type': [u'Budget Buyer']}

{'review_recommend': [u' ', u'Yes, I would recommend this to a friend'], 'review_pros': [u'Covers Well', u'Easy To Apply'], 'review_text': [u"This is my second time purchasing this product. A product I swore by... great coverage, long-lasting. My biggest problem, with any kind of product, is that it seems a lot of them change over time. When products first come out, they're great... but then maybe after a few months they aren't made as well or something? Buying this the first time, I was more than satisfied. Second time around, still great coverage... It just doesn't go on as smooth. I apply with my fingers, and when I put my ring finger in the pot to get some concealer and warm it up a little bit, the consistency isn't as smooth as it was before. I don't know... a lot of products have a way of not working as well as before... But I still think this is the best concealer out there... I'd definitely recommend it to anyone. Pricey yes, but it lasts quite a while and the coverage is very nice!"], 'author_name': [u'Rach Jenk'], 'rating_score': [u'4.0'], 'rating_title': [u'Second time purchasing this product'], 'review_bestuses': [u'Blemishes', u'Broken Capillaries', u'Discoloration', u'Under Eyes'], 'review_cons': [u'Not as smooth as before'], 'date': [u'1/7/2011'], 'author_location': [u'Fort Worth, TX'], 'author_type': [u'Budget Buyer']}

details: This award-winning concealer camouflages dark circles, minor imperfections and discoloration without creasing or fading. Even better...the industrial-strength formula is now available in a full range from light to deep. Now all gals can be imperfection-free.
ingredient: Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Phenyl Trimethicone, Isopropyl Palmitate, Euphorbia Cerifera (Candelilla) Wax, Talc, Paraffinum Liquidum (Mineral Oil), Silica, Kaolin, Cera Microcristallina (Microcrystalline Wax), Nylon-12, Tocopheryl Acetate, Phenoxyethanol, Lecithin, BHT. May Contain: CI 19140 (Yellow 5, Yellow 5 Lake), CI 42090 (Blue 1 Lake), CI 77007 (Ultramarines), CI 77163 (Bismuth Oxychloride), CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499 (Iron Oxides), CI 77891 (Titanium Dioxide.

name: Clinique For Men 2 In 1 Skin Hydrator + Beard Conditioner
details: Try 2 in 1 Skin Hydrator + Beard Conditioner. Applies easily to soften facial hair - from a 1-day stubble to a light beard - and strengthens the skin beneath.

Multi-benefit lotion instantly improves the look of skin and softens the feel of the beard. Applies easily over facial hair, from one-day stubble to a light beard, to soothe the skin beneath. Over time, strengthens skin and conditions beard for easier grooming. Oil-free.
